commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Okay, morning classes are finished. I should go get the music room key.)

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, hey. Want to get some lunch? I'm eating in the cafeteria today.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sorry, Ayumu. I'm going to the music room today, so I can't join you.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Writing music again? You've been writing after school too. Are you doing all right? Are you eating well?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm fine, don't worry. I'm going to write a brilliant song, just you wait.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Okay...sure. Do your best!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (The last part should be strong... No, a gentle piece would be better.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (That's no good. It makes the final part of the song stand out too much.)

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hey!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Wha?! K-Kanata?! And everyone?! What are you doing? I thought you guys had practice.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: We're done! Now we're here to see you.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You were so focused. You didn't even notice us come in.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I even thought you were ignoring us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You did? I'm sorry.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Are you okay? It's not good to hole yourself up like this. Taking a break will help you come up with ideas.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Ahaha, you're right. Thanks, but I'm okay. I'll clean this up, so can you guys give me a minute?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (The beginning will be nice and bright, with an up-tempo melody to get the listeners going. Change keys at the hook and...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (...No no no! This isn't good enough to beat μ's! They're definitely writing a much better song!)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I need to rewrite this. Everything will be fine. I'll definitely write the winning song.)

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: We've been waiting for you, Nijigasaki!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Long time no see! How've you been?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We've been good! You guys look great, too.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Emma, this is enemy territory! You shouldn't be so friendly!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Kasumi, you sound like Nico did a couple weeks ago.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: They really are alike.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Did you write your song?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. Good luck today.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: You too! Thanks for coming.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Now, for the tenth and final contest between μ's and Nijigasaki, the song-off!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: We never decided who should go first, did we?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I'm okay either way.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Then whoever wins rock, paper, scissors will go first! Maki, put your hand out!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Rock, paper, scissor, shoot!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Maki goes first.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: This seems like a bad omen.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: K-Kanata, you don't need to say that!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Don't worry about what Kanata said!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Y-Yeah, we just decided who would go first, nothing more.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Don't worry, guys. I'm fine.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I'm going to start.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Wh-Whoa! As soon as she started playing, the entire atmosphere seemed to change!)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (The music has so much passion it almost seems alive! The melody is flowing around like blood, pumping the heart of the song. It's so hot and exciting...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I know this feeling! It's the same thing I felt when I saw their show with Aqours in Akihabara, and when I saw Aqours' show in Numazu.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (When I close my eyes, I can see μ's singing to this song. I want to see them sing this on stage for real!)
Hey. Hey!
Get it together! Come on!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Gasp*

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Maki finished her song.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Are you okay? You seem like you're in a daze.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: S-Sorry! I'm fine. It's my turn, right? I'll start.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Calm down, just do it like in practice and everything will be fine.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Maki's performance was incredible, but I haven't lost yet. Over these past two weeks, I lost sleep over this song. I practiced my butt off, too.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I researched μ's songs and put everything they didn't have into mine. I can't lose. This song will win. Then, everyone will sing it on stage...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Wait, but...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (What did everyone sound like again? Those voices that will sing my song...)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (What were our shows like? I can't remember.)

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Umm...hello?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Are you going to start or what?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I can't.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm sorry. I can't play this.
